emerging_technologies.name: AI-driven Smart Contracts
emerging_technologies.description: Contracts that automatically execute based on AI's real-time analysis of conditions or external data feeds.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances trust and reduces disputes in contractual agreements, potentially reducing legal costs.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires widespread blockchain adoption, regulatory clarity on AI, and trust in AI decision-making.

emerging_technologies.name: Decentralized Autonomous Transport Networks
emerging_technologies.description: A network where autonomous vehicles operate based on community governance and blockchain-verified decisions.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could revolutionize urban mobility, reducing congestion and pollution, but also poses privacy and control issues.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Dependent on advancements in vehicle autonomy, infrastructure readiness, and public acceptance of decentralized systems.

emerging_technologies.name: Tokenized Energy Markets
emerging_technologies.description: Trading of energy units on a blockchain, allowing for peer-to-peer energy exchange.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Promotes green energy use, empowers consumers, but requires significant infrastructure changes.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Regulatory support, technological readiness of smart grids, and consumer understanding of blockchain.

emerging_technologies.name: Blockchain Identity and Memory Markets
emerging_technologies.description: Secure storage and trading of personal memories or identity data on a blockchain.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Raises profound ethical questions about privacy, consent, and the nature of identity.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Advancements in neural tech, legal frameworks for digital identity, and public trust in blockchain security.

mainstream_technologies.name: Smart Grids
mainstream_technologies.description: Grid systems that integrate renewable energy sources, manage demand response, and incorporate blockchain for energy trading.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widespread adoption in developed nations due to governmental incentives and environmental policies.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI-Personal Assistants
mainstream_technologies.description: AI systems that manage personal tasks, integrate with smart homes, and provide personalized services.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Standard in households and businesses, enhancing daily productivity and convenience.

epoch_themes.description: Shift towards systems that operate autonomously with decentralized governance structures.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Empowers individuals and communities, potentially reducing central control but increasing complexity in governance.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Growing interest in privacy, data sovereignty, and reducing reliance on centralized systems.

epoch_themes.description: Utilizing technology to enhance sustainability efforts, focusing on energy and resource efficiency.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Promotes environmental consciousness, but requires significant changes in consumer behavior and infrastructure.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased focus on climate change mitigation and sustainable living practices.
